text: 33 this morning, Psalm 33, and hold your place here in Psalm 33. We'll be in Genesis chapter number one quite a bit this morning as well, and so you might want to look at both of those places. Stick a bookmark or a ribbon there, a bulletin, something, and I'll be looking at this passage of Scripture. Trust it'll be a blessing to you. As you know, our theme for 2023 is Great is the Lord, and I'm so thankful that our God is great, and as you know, I mentioned last week that the message series, the Sunday morning message series this year will be designed so that it would help each of us to recognize the greatness of God, and then we will be challenged to respond properly to his greatness, and as we go through on Sunday mornings with this plan and this idea, for the next several weeks, I want to deal with this subject matter and examine several messages dealing with God's greatness revealed through creation. God's greatness revealed through creation. This morning, the message, if you've looked on the back of the bulletin, the title is this, He spake and it was done. He spake and it was done. In Psalm 33 and verse number six, the Bible says this, By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth. He gathered the waters of the sea together as an heap. He layeth up the depth and storehouses. Let all the earth fear the Lord. Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him. Verse nine, for he spake and it was done. He commanded and it stood still. Our God is the creator of all things. The Bible declares that to us, it reveals it to us. I've often said over the years that the truth of creation is not isolated to the book of Genesis. So often we go to the book of Genesis and we will this morning and we'll look at the first chapter of the book of Genesis and we'll look at a number of verses of scripture as God gives us the record of creation. We understand that as you study the word of God that the truth of creation is not isolated to Genesis one and two. We find that as you study throughout the word of God that various portions of scripture throughout the whole of scripture reveal to us that God is the creator and it reveals to us the handiwork of our God and that which is given to us, that which is revealed to us through creation. Many of God's people as you study the scriptures, they understood the greatness of God as revealed through creation. They're praying to the one that spoke and it was done as we see in our text of scripture here this morning. We understand that God, our God is the creator God. That ought to increase our faith. That ought to encourage us as we go through life, as we deal with trials and difficulties and we spoke of some of that this morning in our Sunday school hour as we examine some of what the disciples experienced in the persecution there in Acts chapter number four and we understand that we face difficulties just as Hezekiah was facing the most powerful army of that time, the Assyrians.
